title: Lymphedema and lymphatic disease grants program
notes: Establishes the program and limits disclosure of information.

title: Alzheimer's Patient Locator Technology
notes: Establishes a list of possible technologies to assist in locating lost/disoriented Alzheimer's patients, requires physicians to share the list with patients, and requires physicians to maintain a list of patients using such technologies.

title: Information Technology Innovation Center
notes: Creates a center for development, demonstration, and piloting new technologies of benefit to New Yorkers.

title: Bans the non-consensual sale of consumer employment data
notes: Bans the sale of employment data by consumer reporting agencies without written consent of the consumer.

title: Electronic permit applications and recordkeeping
notes: permits the use of electronic filing for business permits or other licenses using e-signatures.

title: defendant fingerprints
notes: allows judges to order fingerprint checks against state and national identification systems.

title: Domestic Violence Protection Act
notes: enacts 'Brittany's Law', which requires the creation of a violent offender registry.

title: Registry of accessible/adaptable housing
notes: requires DHCR to establish a statewide registry of housing that can accommodate people with disabilities. Registry must be accessible by website and phone; requires landlords with 3 or more accessible units to register them with DHCR.

title: Locator technology advisory council (Alzheimer's)
notes: establishes an advisory group to work with DFA to support locator technology for those diagnosed with Alzheimer's. See also A03136, and A03404 for similar objectives.

title: FOIL amendment
notes: broadly excludes collections of data from FOIL disclosure.

title: Bill of Adoptee Rights
notes: defines new privacy protections and procedures for adoptees and birthparents when accessing government records.

title: DMV/NYSPIN integration
notes: enables law enforcement to get updated data for people with open criminal warrants from DMV transactions such as license renewals, registrations, etc).

title: Alzheimer's Program
notes: enables detection, _mapping_, and education for Alzheimer's disease. See also A02610 and A03404 for similar objectives.

title: 'Right to be Forgotten' and data use protections for minors
notes: requires online providers to offer minors the ability to delete their own content. Also limits how personal data may be used for marketing and other purposes, and explicitly prohibits certain products or services from being advertised to minors via online platforms.

title: Researching and recommending technologies to locating missing minors
notes: aims to develop a report on how local governments use technology to help locate minors, and make recommendations for statewide interoperability standards and implementation. See also A02610 and A03136 for similar objectives.

title: Reporting child abuse via instant messaging
notes: requires OCFS to accept reports of child abuse (inclusive of photos) via instant messaging technologies with follow-up full reports within 48 hours, and requires OCFS to maintain data related to the reports.

title: NYCHA open code violations
notes: requires NYCHA to publish data about open code violations.

title: Justice Center reporting
notes: requires weekly public metric reporting and specifies additional details for inclusion in bi-annual reports.

title: Criminal status checks for public assistance applications
notes: requires & enables specific data exchange between NYS DCJS and local government social service agencies.

title: resultsny.gov
notes: requires a public performance reporting web site operated by ITS, and empowers ITS to conduct data collection activites to support it.

title: Creating the Division of Regulatory Review and Economic Growth
notes: enables this new division to obtain any necessary data in support of its goals from other state government entities.

title: Creating a lifespan respite care program
notes: creates the program and enables data gathering and metrics tracking.

title: OCFS data collection
notes: requires certain data to be collected from individuals admitted to certain facilities.

title: Expands identity theft defintion
notes: expands the defintion to include medical and health insurance information.

title: Broadband Development Authority
notes: creates an authority for the purposes of managing provider franchise agreements, requires several analyses and recommendations from the PSC, etc. Might overlap with A02751.

title: Library collection management policies
notes: requires libraries with collections of more than 100,000 items to develop and publish collection management policies.

title: Broadband infrastructure
notes: establishes a non-profit entity which fosters public/private partnerships for broadband delivery and measures development over time. Might overlap with A02118.

title: Automobile Data
notes: requires vehicle owners to be given access to diagnostic and other data which is already accessible to auto manufacturers and 'authorized' repair services.

title: Cyber Terrorism
notes: expands cyber crimes definition and penalties to cover systematic, coordinated attacks.

title: nitric acid sales
notes: requires sellers to track buyers of nitric acid and makes it a class D felony to publish instructions on how to manufacture nitric acid-based explosives on the internet.

title: posting insurance policies online
notes: permits the posting of insurance policies and related materials on provider websites if they do not contain personally identifiable information.

title: Data collection on the homeless
notes: Requires social service agencies and others serving the homeless to collect details on cause of homelessness, to inform any public assistance provided.

title: Construction insurance policy and claim data
notes: Requires information to be submitted periodically to DFS, and permits/requires DFS to publish that information to the public online.

title: Unlawful surveillance using GPS or similar technology
notes: Establishes a class B misdemeanor and civil cause for unlawfully using GPS tracking or other devices to monitor the location of a person without their knowledge or consent. Excludes legal law enforcement activities.

title: North Star Initiative
notes: Enables the North Star Commission to receive any data from other governmental entities as needed to perform its function.

title: New York Health Program
notes: Requires care coordinators to submit records to the Department of Health; provides for privacy protection of individual records, but sets derived aggregated information (where it does not violate confidentiality) as public information.

title: Use of automatic license plate readers by private entities and law enforcement
notes: Makes it illegal for non-law enforcement entities to use automated license plate readers. Permits specific uses of ALPRs relevant to DMV, DCJS, NCIC, FBI, Amber Alerts, and parking enforcement; sets limits on data retention. Requires law enforcement bodies using ALPR to develop and publish policies governing and metrics related to their use.

title: County Medicaid Fraud Detection
notes: Sets up a grant program in the Department of Health to reimburse county expenses for the implementation of data mining tools to counter Medicaid fraud.

title: Health Information Technology Week
notes: October 5-9, 2015 is proclaimed 'Health Information Technology Week'.

title: Felony release of personal data
notes: makes it a Class E felony to release personal data (specifically defined in the bill) without authorization.

title: Auto insurance claims
notes: requires insurance claims to be reoprted to DFS and published publicly.

title: Cyber Security Initiative
notes: Establishes a cyber security initiative comprising of a cyber security advisory board based in DHSES, with 5 members appointed by the governor and 6 members appointed by the legislature. It will develop policies and recommendations for both public and private sector - some specifically defined in the bill.

title: Defines the cyber terrorism as a crime
notes: Defines cyber terrorism in the first (class A felony) and second (class C felony) degrees.

title: Cyber-Security Reports (5-year)
notes: Requires, every five years, the development and publication of a detailed cyber-security report. This report would contain details of all cyber-security activities undertaken in the state, and appears to include a scope of both public sector and private sector entities.

title: Updates the definition of crimimal posession of computer related material
notes: Redefines the existing defintion of the crime as second degree (class E felony), and adds a definition of the crime in the first degree (class B felony).

title: Terrorist Registry Act
notes: Establishes a data exchange between DCJS, DSP, and DHSES. May also require the publication of the registry on a website.

title: Skills for direct support professional jobs for the developmentally disabled act
notes: requires the Office of Mental Health to compile a report (based upon data from other agencies) on anticipated workforce needs.
